items.title: Banks vs Fintech firms: Rivals or partners?
items.author: Kosta Du
items.description:
Fintechs, these economics sector startups, appeared hardly twenty years ago, in the face of a banking sector that was already centuries old.

Association between banks, insurance, and asset management groups and finance startups have, to a specific size, followed the circle of human passions. At first, insignificant to these “pipsqueaks,” traditional financial institutions soon began to show a particular annoyance at their bravery, followed by a genuine interest in their high-tech and useful revolution. In some respects, the current situation is sometimes like a loving feeling, given the fintech theme’s apparent potential, notably amongst younger generations.

Strengths and Weaknesses of Traditionals Versus Fintechs

Fintechs and established players bring their strengths and weaknesses to the table. To overcome the battle shaping up to redefine the options of customers’ financial services, I have put together a brief scouting report that estimates the points to the game. Each group should consider ensuring that they appear on the other side with a critical mass of consumers firmly in their corner.

Fintech Powers. Fintechs have enormous benefits. Except for youth — and the media buzz has, for the most part, inclined positively in favor — their main power turns around the transformation that links with their marks. They bring the latest image that has an exact attraction to those customers who still carry some touching things from the Great Recession, even more than a decade later.

Most fintech has also taken advantage of the feature that they manage to focus on giving a focused best of breed service around specific financial offering. It does not pretend to be a one-stop-shop for all financial needs. Consequently, they have made inroads with consumers who care about the limited features of their economic lives.

Fintech Imperfection. Its focus is narrow, although it is also the source of its most vulnerable. J.D. Power’s research indicates severe worries from buyers about controlling a fractional set of financial assets.

A significant number of customers among Millenary — are not definitely about using different contributors to guide deposits, lease, fund, and plan their pension. The close focus of the touchpoints that lead to the development of trusted relationships. It’s a challenge increased by most fintech’s choice to limit their interactions with consumers to digital channels.

Traditional Banking Institution Powers. Famous banks and credit unions operate with an entirely different set of dynamics. These players tend to have an existing solid bond that has been in a spot for a long time, not decades. And if ownership is nine-tenths of the legislation, the confirmed participant still retains most consumer accounts across the financial services spectrum.

Far from fintech, established banks can still benefit from personal relations at department offices to petrify relations with customers — just as they add on their digital strategies. There is a “gluey” correspondence between the number of services that institutions offer any given consumer and that consumer’s unwillingness to develop their financial commerce elsewhere.

It is vital to note that the big public banks — and to a proportionately lesser extent, large regional institutions — have the capital to invest in their digital transformation action. Many use these resources to better position themselves in this new digital era by investing in evolving technologies — such as mobility, artificial intelligence, machine learning, and big data analytics. To succeed deeper and understand what each client wants from solutions that address the different segments of their financial lives.

Traditional Banking Institution Weaknesses. While established players are neither down nor out in the fight for consumer loyalty, they do have challenges that need to address relatively urgently.

The number one challenge that we see in J.D. Power consumer reviews is that traditional financial institutions still have significant work to repair consumer trust damaged during the last recession. It is a trauma that always manifests itself across consumers who experienced significant losses and delays to their financial lives. As a result, many traditional brands in financial services still have a stubborn, harmful perception problem.

The second challenge that traditional banks and lenders must address concerns in improving consumers’ digital experience. And financial resources distributed to create new digital offerings. Many of these enterprises are not well integrated with their more established call center or brick-and-mortar operations, making frustrations for a “fickle” customer base.

The complexity of actual structure — built on generations of difficult-to-integrate legacy technologies — combined with an incumbent culture that may not optimize for nowadays digital marketplace, is acting as a barrier to the kind of progress that many consumers expect from their financial services providers.

items.title: The latest on fintech startups and cryptocurrency trends
items.author: Kosta Du
items.description:
Fintech startups have revolutionized Finance and how people and businesses use and manage their money. Fintech startups are challenging banks and other financial institutions through innovation over diverse economic segments and industries by tackling financial problems and needs.

More commonly referred to as Fintech companies, financial technology companies generally focus on disrupting specific business models through financial innovation. Relying on technology to make business processes simpler, reach broader audiences, or focus on particular customers, they often compete against more traditional economic actors who used less efficient business methods. And since they develop in an industry where the money is a commodity, Fintech startups that implement successful new business models often reap considerable benefits very rapidly.

Regarding the actual markets and financial segments are being successfully tackled by Fintech companies, we can remark that several startups are digital banks, referred to as “virtual banks” or “neo banks.” This new type of bank’s success proves that banking’s business model without physical branches is gaining traction worldwide.

Many other financial services and industries are being interrupted, containing insurance (with insurance technologies startups often referred to as “InsurTech”), payments, brokerage, transaction processing, mortgage, and more.

In many cases, innovation in financial technologies comes from creating cryptocurrencies, such as Bitcoin and Ethereum. And even more, the principal Blockchain technology that allows their decentralization and security. Some startups use these new technologies to create more effective ways of doing business by supervising decentralized and protected financial ledgers at a fraction of previous technologies’ cost.

Indeed, since the American market is much larger and more solvable than other markets, it is no surprise to find American startups making up a large part of the top 30 in the world’s best-funded Fintech startups. However, British startups are also well-represented, thanks to the British economy’s traditional focus on the financial industry and the City of London being one of the world’s top financial centers.

China counts several other companies involved in payments and other financial services, which are already publicly listed companies. Some of the countries’ largest tech companies, such as the giant Chinese Fintech company, Ant Financial, are part of the Alibaba Group.

One of the advantages of this change in the traditional financial ecosystem’s perception is the cryptocurrency range.

Ian Balina, creator and chief executive of Token Metrics, told Finance Magnates that he sees the adoption and identification of cryptocurrencies as the most crucial evolution in fintech in the year ahead. Token Metrics is an AI-driven cryptocurrency investigation company that uses artificial intelligence to build crypto indicators, rankings, and price projections.

“The most significant fintech trends in 2021 will be cryptocurrencies,” Ballina said. “We expect bitcoin to surpass its prior all-time high and go over $20k per Bitcoin. Fintech will bring on mainstream media awareness bitcoin has not received since December 2017.”

The founder pointed to several recent high-profile crypto investments from institutional investors as evidence that crypto will poise for a final year: “the crypto aspect is a lot more evolve, with strong approval from honored companies like PayPal, Square, Facebook, JP Morgan, and Samsung,” he said.

Gregory Keough, the DMM Foundation organizer, the Defi Money Market (DMM) organization, also thinks that crypto will play a significant role in the year ahead. “We are sure that digital assets will be much more coherent into our monetary systems after the pandemic pass. Possibly even forming the basis for the global economy with the adoption of central bank digital currencies (CBDCs) and increasing use of stable coins like USDC in decentralized Finance (Defi) systems,” Keough said.

Anti Danilevski, chief executive and founder of Kick Ecosystem and KickEX exchange, further commented that “cryptocurrencies will also continue to an extent and gain mass penetration, as these assets are easy to buy and sell. They are internationally decentralized, are a great way to hedge risks, and have huge growth potential.”

items.title: The future of Fintech Banking
items.author: Kosta Du
items.description:
We are already going through one of the most critical metamorphosis in business history — the FinTech evolution. And it’s going to switch banking as we know it.

For short, financial technology, or FinTech, is the innovative use of technology to design and deliver business assistance. It’s changing finance through a broad range of benefits and technologies, from artificial intelligence and blockchain to digital payments and robot-advisors.

Fintechs typically offer “better user experience, lower fees, and a customized focus on clearing up a fixed issue. They can also develop products faster and cheaper than big banks as they don’t have the legacy staff and systems to fund or contend with.”

Traditional banks are generally slower to the punch when it comes to this, and charges will hit many people, large margins, and limited hours in which they can seek assistance from customer support.

The big banks’ infrastructure also allows little room for agility — meaning that fintech could extent and grow aggressively, offering new products and services all the time, while the banks are merely getting on digital technologies to improve their existing services.

A bit of history

Historically, as technology evolved, the banking services industry used to be quite fast to adopt innovations to serve customers better. However, all of this changed during the global financial crisis of 2008.

During the crisis, banks focused on complying with the numerous new rules, regulatory requirements, and fines imposed on them. Innovation was a very distant priority.

In the same period, technology was having an unprecedented boom. During that same period, there was a series of game-changing technological innovations that transformed how we lived and became part of our daily lives — the iPhone, Airbnb, Uber, WhatsApp, WeChat — for example. There was already a considerable gap between traditional banks’ technologies and the rising standards of modern customers. They demanded more flexibility, convenience, and a streamlined user experience.

How are banks reacting?

Banks are worried about these large tech firms as they not only have much-existing information with clients like yourselves every day but also have, to a precise extent, your protection and assurance. For example, if you share your kids’ photos on Facebook, wouldn’t you count on them to transfer money to your family as well? If you buy most of your daily basics from Amazon, wouldn’t you also use them to search and purchase insurance products as well?

What also worries banks is that thousands of new and dynamic FinTech startups now offer products that used to be controlled by traditional financial players. For example, peer to peer lending platforms now provides customers an alternative for loans that you used to get from a bank. Robo-advisory platforms offer asset management solutions that are more transparent in what they charge you and substantially cheaper.

But banks realize that the landscape is changing and surviving. They need to develop. Some banks will thrive in this evolution by embedding this culture of innovation and entrepreneurship across their organization. But many will not.

Citibank predicts that over the next ten years, direct job losses but also indirect ones will damage the related economy around the financial services industry, from law firms and accounting firms to hotels and restaurants. In the future, some new jobs will create with FinTechs but in substantially smaller numbers. And these are very different jobs with very different skill sets than those required from bankers today — these new jobs are for programmers and data scientists, not traders or compliance officers.

In conclusion, the FinTech industry is continuing to transform how financial services are delivered. Consumers will generally be great beneficiaries from a user experience or convenience perspective and access and cost savings.

items.title: How To Start A FinTech Company?
items.author: Kosta Du
items.description:
Even though you don’t trade bitcoins and do not know how stocks work, there is still a possibility you have used one or two fintech apps, e.g., online payments or mobile banking solutions. The use of Fintech globally reached an average of 64%. Thus, there is no refusing that technologies will continue to conquer the age-old financial industry. Half of the executives surveyed by Capgemini consider the new entries to be a significant threat to the traditional providers.

But how do you even enroll in Fintech?

With hundreds of startups trying to enter the market every month and the billion-dollar giants that run the show, it can be hard to get your piece of the cake.

In this article, we’ll talk about the difficulties of starting a fintech company and how to navigate securely through and create your own successful Fintech company.

Top fintech applications and their technique for success

Who wouldn’t want to learn from those who already have made it big? So before looking into the method for success, let’s first look at some current fintech companies and find out what has been their secret tip.

Stripe

Niche: Online Payment Services
Funding:

· Increased a total of $685M in nine rounds.

· Now valued at $36B.

Stripe is an online payment company that first accepts payments, sends payouts, and manages their businesses online. It offers compensation for e-commerce websites and mobile applications. We also help companies beat fraud, send invoices, get financing, manage business spending, and much more.

Mint

Niche: Personal finance management
Funding: $31.8M across five rounds; received by Intuit in 2009 for $170M

Mint is a personal finance app provided by Intuit. The app manages your finances with Mint’s online budget planner. Our free budget tracker helps you understand your spending and bring together all of your accounts, bills, and more for a brighter financial future.

Robinhood

Niche: investments and trading
Funding: $539M across five funding rounds

The company offers commission-free investing, a mobile app, and a website that provides people the ability to invest in stocks, ETFs, and options through Robinhood Financial and crypto trading through Robinhood Crypto. We offer the tools you need to put money in motion.

Oscar Health

Niche: insurance
Funding: $892.5M across seven rounds

Oscar Health is the first health insurance company built to make health care easy. Our focus on simplifying health care for the consumer is what represents our company.

Coinbase

Niche: digital currency exchange
Funding: $300M across eight rounds

Coinbase is a secure platform that makes it easy to buy, sell, and store cryptocurrency like Bitcoin, Ethereum, and more.

You might have noticed that some of the ordinary words used to describe all of the listed services are “easy” or “affordable,” and it’s not a coincidence. Such products’ simplicity and availability represent a decisive competitive advantage, making it possible for the listed companies to compete with the current market leaders.

How to get started?

Researching about finding the product is the most crucial step you can take to settle a solid foundation for your app’s development. It incorporates a functional specification, UX/UI design, and a visual prototype to give you a vision of the end product. Mostly, this phase takes 4–6 weeks.

The product discovery phase can help you:

▪ define a roadmap for the project

▪ set a realistic budget for your foundation

▪ check over your audience using a visible example

▪ craft a convincing investment pitch

▪ get to know your team

To conclude this article, I hope we gave you some inspiration for the road that a new company goes in. Especially, Fintech may not be the most comfortable industry to target. It takes a lot of work, expertise, creativity, and professionalism to launch a competitive trade startup.

If you believe that you will solve your users’ financial issues through innovative ways, go for it. You will also need the right people by your side. A team with formidable technical skills and perfect domain expertise will help in building something great.

items.title: Contactless Payment In Latin America With Ruben Raul Diaz Silva
items.author: Kosta Du
items.description:
“It is not about technology. It is about people adopting the technology”, said Ruben in an intriguing session on contactless payment with Kosta Du. Every country is different, and every country reacts to technology differently. Fintech in the UK can be completely different from fintech in the USA. To explore the diverse ecosystem of Latin America, Kosta du interviewed Ruben Raul Diaz Silva. From locals adjusting with the technology to the cybersecurity condition, they discussed various elements of fintech beyond today. They discussed the future of contactless payments in America.

Background

Ruben Raul Diaz Silva has been working in Information and communication technology for 25 years. In 2010 he was appointed as the vice minister of telecommunications in Ecuador. His focus is on developing fintech in Ecuador Banking software companies. He explains to the credit unions and various companies about the world of fintech. He assists the Information technology companies who plan to settle in America. From the condition of the fintech industry to the cultural background of the country, he supervises various institutions in all aspects. Thus, he is the ideal person to learn from the status of contactless payments and fintech in Latin America.

Condition Of Contactless Payment In Latin America

Currently, in America, contactless payment is a rare phenomenon. In Latin America, people are still using magnetic cards to make payments. America is planning to introduce 100 million neo contactless cards next year. According to Ruben, the reason behind the scarcity of contactless payment in America is the lack of stimulus. America has the technology to shift to contactless payments, but the people were not ready to adopt such technology. They needed an external stimulus to motivate them to use contactless payments, and COVID-19 has proved to be a great stimulus. Thus, in the coming 1 or 2 financial years, the financial industry will witness significant developments in terms of technology.

Cyber Security In Latin America

Unlike Zimbabwe, South Africa, or the Republic of the Congo, America is not scared to use contactless payments due to security reasons. Cybersecurity is highly developed in Latin America. The financial institutions are always on alert mode and have developed their security system to be immune to any kind of fraud.

Problems With Contactless Payment In Latin America

As explained by Ruben, the real problems with contactless payment in America are the proportion of bank users and lack of experience in American technology developers. In Latin America, approximately 70% of citizens do not have a formal bank account. So without having a bank account, it is impossible to carry out the contactless payment. Another reason is that small businesses in America cannot afford the expensive system required for enabling card payments. But the silver lining is the contactless payment requires only a $100 smartphone and a visa Mastercard. If American banks are interested, they can also launch the POS system for contactless payments. Furthermore, technology developers are not experienced in dealing with the regulators or reaching the global market.

Opportunities For Fintech In Latin America

The UK has the one thing that America lacks. A mutual understanding between the Us based start-ups and UK fintech could lead to a huge opportunity for both the participants. United states are like an underserved nation. It has the resources, but the proportion of populations served by the banks are very low.

items.content:
“It is not about technology. It is about people adopting the technology”, said Ruben in an intriguing session on contactless payment with Kosta Du. Every country is different, and every country reacts to technology differently. Fintech in the UK can be completely different from fintech in the USA. To explore the diverse ecosystem of Latin America, Kosta du interviewed Ruben Raul Diaz Silva. From locals adjusting with the technology to the cybersecurity condition, they discussed various elements of fintech beyond today. They discussed the future of contactless payments in America.

Background

Ruben Raul Diaz Silva has been working in Information and communication technology for 25 years. In 2010 he was appointed as the vice minister of telecommunications in Ecuador. His focus is on developing fintech in Ecuador Banking software companies. He explains to the credit unions and various companies about the world of fintech. He assists the Information technology companies who plan to settle in America. From the condition of the fintech industry to the cultural background of the country, he supervises various institutions in all aspects. Thus, he is the ideal person to learn from the status of contactless payments and fintech in Latin America.

Condition Of Contactless Payment In Latin America

Currently, in America, contactless payment is a rare phenomenon. In Latin America, people are still using magnetic cards to make payments. America is planning to introduce 100 million neo contactless cards next year. According to Ruben, the reason behind the scarcity of contactless payment in America is the lack of stimulus. America has the technology to shift to contactless payments, but the people were not ready to adopt such technology. They needed an external stimulus to motivate them to use contactless payments, and COVID-19 has proved to be a great stimulus. Thus, in the coming 1 or 2 financial years, the financial industry will witness significant developments in terms of technology.

Cyber Security In Latin America

Unlike Zimbabwe, South Africa, or the Republic of the Congo, America is not scared to use contactless payments due to security reasons. Cybersecurity is highly developed in Latin America. The financial institutions are always on alert mode and have developed their security system to be immune to any kind of fraud.

Problems With Contactless Payment In Latin America

As explained by Ruben, the real problems with contactless payment in America are the proportion of bank users and lack of experience in American technology developers. In Latin America, approximately 70% of citizens do not have a formal bank account. So without having a bank account, it is impossible to carry out the contactless payment. Another reason is that small businesses in America cannot afford the expensive system required for enabling card payments. But the silver lining is the contactless payment requires only a $100 smartphone and a visa Mastercard. If American banks are interested, they can also launch the POS system for contactless payments. Furthermore, technology developers are not experienced in dealing with the regulators or reaching the global market.

Opportunities For Fintech In Latin America

items.title: The First Tap-On-Phone With Pin Entering
items.author: Kosta Du
items.description:
The First Tap-On-Phone With PIN Entering

Contactless payments are gaining more and more popularity every day. Fintech has changed the face of finance. With technological developments and innovative solutions, finance is improving every day. Fintech beyond today focuses on improving your experience. It aims at making finance more convenient for you.

Sending and receiving payments through your smartphones have been around for a long time now. You can use your android devices to receive payments for the sales you have made online as well as offline. Tap-on-phone payments and Soft POS have made it easy for users to carry out transactions through handy devices. But there is always a scope for improvement.

Until now there was no solution for sending or receiving payments through Tap on phone with pin code. Until now there was no solution for sending or receiving payments through Soft POS beyond the CVM limit specified by the states. But now Kotsu Du presents you with a novel solution that will make your life easier.

With this Soft POS solution, you will be able to send and receive payments with pin code. With this tap-on-phone solution, you will be able to make and collect payments that are beyond the CVM limit. Earlier in the UK, you could not receive payments beyond 45 pounds but with this solution you can. Similarly, with this, you can send payments beyond 50 euros in Europe.

This solution aims to overcome the limitations set by pin code and CVM restrictions. If you were holding back due to such limitations, then this is the solution to your problems. You will be able to expand your horizons and conveniently participate in financial transactions through your smartphone.

We are working towards accepting payments beyond the CVM limit with pin entering so that tomorrow you can benefit from it. All you will have to do is enter the amount. Then scan your Visa card and next fill in your pin code. Congratulations! despite the fact that your amount might be beyond the CVM limit you will be able to initiate the transaction with pin entering.

This is a tap-on-phone solution with pin entering. It will save you time and will enhance your experience. Your smartphones are now more useful than ever. So why not increase its efficiency and let it handle large payments as well. This Software Point of Sale solution will save you time and effort. It is quick, simple, and developed only for you.

For this solution, you only need your smartphone, visa card, and pin code. In a matter of clicks, you will be able to make payments and in a matter of minutes, you will be able to receive large payments. With technology growing every minute your life is becoming easier and easier. This is just another contribution to solve your problems and help you develop. Do check the video for a demonstration and benefit from the fintech beyond today.

items.title: Insight of FinTech in Future
items.author: Kosta Du
items.description:
Technology has become our best friend in recent years. The new and modern techs that improve and update about every single day add to our life experience and make things easier for us day in and day out. This sits true for every field and it works in every aspect of our life whether it is personal or professional.

So, today we will focus on the impact of technology in one such field that is the finance. Tech in the past few years has completely revolutionized the concept of delivery of financial service and it has positively aided the development of this sector. So, in our blog today, we will talk about FinTech and the insight that it can offer us on the future of banking.

Banking of the Future

Banks today are moving away from their brick and mortar existence, and they are trying to expand their territories and to improve their customer experience. But since banks by their nature are huge, and they are unable to innovate fast, they need assistance. This is where FinTech comes in. It tries to reduce the existing gap between small skills and big banks so that it can bring up innovative solutions to serve the customers and to generate revenues from them.

The digital banks that are functioning today are putting in efforts to differentiate themselves from the traditional banks. So, if you approach any digital bank for setting up a business account, unlike the traditional banks that take about 2–4 weeks to complete the process, the digital banks are getting everything done in about 15–20 minutes. These banks are also offering highly intuitive and easy to use apps, that is granting an exceptional customer experience. And finally, the digital banks also giving customers access to a local switch or separate faster payments. These are some reasons why digital banks are being seen in a different light.

Now, as for the fundamentals of growth of these banks in the future, they can be identified very easily. All that a bank needs to do in order to survive the future is to figure out who is your target audience, what is your proposition, and what services can you provide your customers that are easily accessible and can be offered at cheaper rates. Once you have your different proposition, your different way of positioning things for a particular target audience base in place your growth will begin.

In order to grow and succeed in the future, another angle that banks can consider is problem-solving. So if you are a bank who is solving a problem for its customer, then the chances of your survival in the future double-up. Channel vast is one company that is doing this. In a continent where credit scoring does not exist, it has discovered a way of offering micro-lending based on your mobile phone lending records. As a result, Channel vast has become a fast-developing company in Africa that has a huge reach.

Thus, these are some insights that Fintech offers about the growth and development of banking in the future.

items.title: “Who will Google buy in response to Apple?”
items.author: Kosta Du
items.description:
“Whom will Google buy in response to Apple?”

Apple is always ahead of the whole planet! Apple now has the technology to turn an iPhone into a payment terminal. Apple paid about $100 million for this buy. Whether this is a lot or not, we will only be able to understand when all iPhone owners start using this technology. But that’s not the point now. Do not forget Two things: — not everyone likes iPhones - Apple is not the last company in the world.

So, who will compete with the “Bitten Apple”? And take more modern and refined start-ups in the market of the FINTECH industry?! Putting two major Market players on the scale of Apple: Google and Samsung. Once among the world leaders went to such a battle for the buy of start-ups in the post-terminal market… Since news of such purchases blows up the world market… Let’s figure out who they are — these terminals, and what they eat with
Mobeewave, an Apple-acquired alternative to Paymob POS, has got a ready-to-use Tap-on-Phone solution. It is not necessary to compare these two start-ups, but it is worth mentioning that Paymob has taken a little step forward in the section of this solution. Paymob is an innovative service that provides the ability to accept credit cards anywhere in world. They also provide universal access to international payment systems: VISA, MasterCard, Alipay, American express etc. with very flexible, practical, intuitive and reliable functional. The service allows you to accept payments by VISA, Master cards, using mobile terminal and free application, available for iOS and Android devices.
Of course, such technologies are convenient for people in modern life. And each of us wants to be able to get the greatest comfort for ourselves.
Paymob focuses on convenience and profit. Paymob Technology is an experienced IT firm founded in 2011 and focuses on card payment services, bank processing systems, mobile devices and payment terminals. The company develops innovative products that meet all international security standards for electronic payment. Paymob Technology’s innovative product is known for its integrated platform for mobile commerce and banking services using customized app.
Their unique selling proposition to the bank is the Paymob Smart POS, a turnkey solution which includes both the best in class hardware and bespoke software solutions.
“The smartphone as a POS”. In practice, this solution can be used by clients in various business areas (shops, restaurants, courier service, taxis, public transport, medicine (doctors), freelancers, etc)

Tap on Phone Payments. What is this finally?
Smartphones can act as a contactless POS terminal for merchants, without the need for extra hardware. Whether consumers use a contactless card, smartphone, or wearable device, “Tap on Phone” Soft POS provides merchants the flexibility of mobile contactless payment acceptance.
The advantages of Paymob over other similar companies (for example, Mobeewave, Cardfree, Forte Payment System, MyPay etc) are that mPOS implements enable service and sales organizations to conduct financial transactions in a more versatile manner without having to be tethered to a single location. This improves the customer experience (CX) by speeding up service and wait times and offering many payment options. It also frees up valuable space that would otherwise be dedicated to a countertop POS.
What price is Paymob willing to give For their technology?
World leaders (GOOGLE, SAMSUNG, HUAWEI, XIAOMI, OPPO, LG) should think about buying such solutions sooner, before the price rises above the already sold Apple Mobeewave.

items.title: Opening box of first Smart POS terminal from Paymob
items.author: Kosta Du
items.description:
https://medium.com/media/b5af732176f2287a7bc3f094fde1a898/href

After months on Research and Development, we are finally ready with PayMob’s latest Smart POS Terminal device. I received one device from the first batch that has manufactured for sales. Unboxing a new device that you’ve been waiting months for is one of the most exciting experiences.

In this article, I will unbox the device with you and give you a brief description of what you’ll receive when you unbox your own Smart POS terminal.

Package Production and Labelling

The package itself that carries the device designed after a lot of speculation and thought. We talked to our package manufacturer to select the material for packaging and to our graphic designer to decide upon the labelling of the package. The package plays an essential role in the branding of the product and must match up to the company’s reputation.

The small space offered on the package of any product must be utilized by offering important information to the customers. The Label is also an essential aspect of product branding. For example, the icons on the back of the package are the logos of our partners in production and operations.

This package of this POS device talks provides information like product description, delivery procedure, contents of the box, etc. The colours used for packaging are white and red, to replicate technology and innovation. The package made with strong material to ensure its safety during shipment and delivery.

The package is just as classy as the ones used by Apple. However, unboxing the package and receiving a Smart POS device is an altogether different experience than receiving an iPhone. This device will make your business transaction easier and more convenient.

Contents Of The Package

When you open the box, you will find our latest Smart POS device, a tiny instruction manual, roll of receipt paper, USB charging cable, and charger. It is possible to get a Smart POS device designed in the colour of your company. For example, if your company logo is red, you can get a Smart POS device in the red colour.

Setting Up The device

To start the device, you must first turn on your battery. If you have a sim card available you can insert it in the device right away. When you switch on your terminal, you will see the logo of your brand on the screen of the machine. The personalization feature is an aspect of our branding and we offer the same to our partners when they purchase a white-label solution.

After the loading has completed, you will come across a launch screen. This screen has keypad and touch audios that you will hear when you take an action.

The next step is to connect the device to a Wi-Fi or Sim card network, personally I prefer Wi-Fi connection. Now that its connected and the address has been verified, you can launch a demo application for payment acceptance.

You need to enter your credentials and then your cashier Pincode on the device. You can use easy combinations like 1234 to get easy access whenever you want. When you perform your first transaction, you will need to connect the printer to the device.

To make a demo payment, you will have to present your card to the device and enter your Pincode. You will notice mixed numbers because we have applied our ‘Pin on Glass’ technology. You can learn more about this in one of my other articles. And this is, you are ready to use your new Smart POS terminal at your workplace.

After two to three months of working on branding, production, and delivery we’re happy that the product is brilliant and efficient. To learn more about Smart POS Terminal machines and how to use them, you can read my other blogs.

Opening box of first Smart POS terminal from Paymob was originally published in Kosta Du on Medium, where people are continuing the conversation by highlighting and responding to this story.

items.title: Accept Payments With Your Smartphone POS By Following these Five Steps
items.author: Kosta Du
items.description:
In my last article, I explained the new soft technology by PayMob that enables merchants to accept contactless payments with the help of their smartphones. This technology is extremely beneficial for small businesses who need a smart POS terminal device, but find it expensive to acquire. Another benefit of the technology is that you can carry the smartphone with you anywhere without a problem.

For example, if you have to make product deliveries and accept payments, you can easily enable your delivery guy to accept contactless payment on their phone.

In this article, I will explain how to complete transactions on your smartphone, in some simple steps.

Firstly, I have two phones with me, one of them will be the merchant’s phone and the other is the buyer’s phone. The merchant phone is a blueberry and the buyer’s phone will be my iPhone.

So all we have here is a phone and not a POS device to perform a payment. Yet, it can accept payments via QR code, barcode, and even debit and credit cards.

  1. Merchant Activation: First you have to activate the payment portal on the merchant phone. You need to insert your cashier credentials and Pincode.
  2. Insert amount: To process the payment you need to enter the amount that the buyer is supposed to pay you. For example, here I am selling a delicious muffin to myself. I will be charging 5 Euros for the muffin and have inserted the same amount on my payments interface.
  3. Customer Activation: On the customer phone you have to open the application and activate it. The interface on the customer phone will be different from that of the merchant’s. Once you have activated your QR code or Barcode, it will show on the screen of your smartphone.

If instead of a smartphone, the buyer wants to pay via their card then they can also do so.

  1. Turn on the Camera: To process the payment. the merchant has to now allow the app to access the mobile’s camera and open it to be able to scan the QR code, barcode, or card strip.
  2. Scan the code: If the customer is willing to pay the amount that is being presented on the merchant’s screen then they must hold their smartphone beneath the merchant’s phone. The camera from the merchant’s phone will scan the barcode. Once the scan has been successfully completed, the payment will have been made and the amount will be deducted from the customer’s account.

If you wish to, you can also refund this money one click. All you need to do is select the customer you wish to refund the money to, from your previous transactions. Click on ‘Perform a Refund’ and voila, the refund will be successful.

In my last article, I explained the new soft technology by PayMob that enables merchants to accept contactless payments with the help of their smartphones. This technology is extremely beneficial for small businesses who need a smart POS terminal device, but find it expensive to acquire. Another benefit of the technology is that you can carry the smartphone with you anywhere without a problem.

For example, if you have to make product deliveries and accept payments, you can easily enable your delivery guy to accept contactless payment on their phone.

In this article, I will explain how to complete transactions on your smartphone, in some simple steps.

Firstly, I have two phones with me, one of them will be the merchant’s phone and the other is the buyer’s phone. The merchant phone is a blueberry and the buyer’s phone will be my iPhone.

So all we have here is a phone and not a POS device to perform a payment. Yet, it can accept payments via QR code, barcode, and even debit and credit cards.

  1. Merchant Activation: First you have to activate the payment portal on the merchant phone. You need to insert your cashier credentials and Pincode.
  2. Insert amount: To process the payment you need to enter the amount that the buyer is supposed to pay you. For example, here I am selling a delicious muffin to myself. I will be charging 5 Euros for the muffin and have inserted the same amount on my payments interface.
  3. Customer Activation: On the customer phone you have to open the application and activate it. The interface on the customer phone will be different from that of the merchant’s. Once you have activated your QR code or Barcode, it will show on the screen of your smartphone.

If instead of a smartphone, the buyer wants to pay via their card then they can also do so.

  1. Turn on the Camera: To process the payment. the merchant has to now allow the app to access the mobile’s camera and open it to be able to scan the QR code, barcode, or card strip.
  2. Scan the code: If the customer is willing to pay the amount that is being presented on the merchant’s screen then they must hold their smartphone beneath the merchant’s phone. The camera from the merchant’s phone will scan the barcode. Once the scan has been successfully completed, the payment will have been made and the amount will be deducted from the customer’s account.

If you wish to, you can also refund this money one click. All you need to do is select the customer you wish to refund the money to, from your previous transactions. Click on ‘Perform a Refund’ and voila, the refund will be successful.
